Role Summary: Develop software to meet user needs
Follow best-practice guidelines and help to improve those guidelines
Write clean, secure and well-tested code
Coach and mentor more junior colleagues
Be an established, productive, professional contributor
Can completely lead small projects or tasks through various stages of the software lifecycle
Has advanced knowledge of the system. Problems faced are difficult and sometimes complex
Reviews the work of other colleagues
Influences others regarding policies, practices and procedures
If clearances allow, operate the services they build and identify issues in production
Code & Build: Collaborate with others when necessary to review requirements/user stories and use these agreed specifications to design, code, test and document programs or scripts of medium to high complexity using the right standards and tools
Information Security: Designs solutions and services with security control embedded, specifically engineered as mitigation against security threats as a core part of the solutions and services, under the direction of technical lead or more senior engineers
Modern Standards Approach: Can competently use a modern standards approach and guide others in so doing
Systems Design: Documents work using required standards, methods and tools, including prototyping tools where appropriate
Designs sub-systems or components characterised by managed levels of risk, manageable business and technical complexity, and meaningful impact
As part of the design process identifies appropriate patterns to use
Systems Integration: Can build and test simple interfaces between systems, or work on more complex integration as part of a wider team
Development Process Optimisation: Explains the importance of developing process efficiency and the common ways in which processes are optimised
Supports specific activities to improve development processes
User Focus: Prioritises and defines the approach to understand the user story, guiding others in doing so
Organisational Impact: Works to achieve day-to-day objectives with key impacts on operational results within the system
May be accountable for small projects or processes within area of responsibility
Problem Solving & Complexity: Problems and issues faced are general, and may require understanding of broader set of issues, and are sometimes complex
Problems typically involve consideration of multiple issues, systems of specialties
Problems are typically solved through drwaing from prior experience and analysis of issues
Responsible for making moderate improvements of processes, systems or products to enhance performance of the system
Communication & Influence: Communicates with parties within and outside of own immediate team
May have responsibility for communicating with parties external to the organization (e.g. customers)
